intro: Glochidion monostylum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved glabrous vine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Glochidion monostylum is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for various insects and birds.
